description: System-generated unique identifier for each audited data-change event.
Name of the source database where the audited change occurred (environment/context of the table).
Name of the business table impacted by the audited operation.
Database schema name (logical domain/module) of the impacted table.
Numeric code for the type of operation performed (e.g., insert, update, delete); maps to an audit action lookupâ€”confirm mapping with SME.
Client or server host that initiated the database change, captured from the connection.
Application reported by the database connection that executed the change (client program or driver).
User or service account that executed the change, as captured by the database session.
Timestamp when the change was recorded in the audit log (database server time).
Number of rows impacted by the operation; useful for bulk updates, inserts, or deletes.
Database object identifier of the target object involved in the change (likely sys.objects.object_id in SQL Server; confirm with SME).
